ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] DOTs, extremely impressive
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey it worked for me.  I don t even have the Chants yet and I ve still been having fun playing around with my instruments more because of that write up. Kit
ygData.messageBody:
Hey it worked for me. I don't even have the Chants yet and I've still been
having fun playing around with my instruments more because of that write up.

Kit

"thinking about that shield thing"

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 11, 2000 11:17 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] DOTs, extremely impressive


On Tue, 11 Apr 2000, Miriana wrote:
> On Tue, 11 Apr 2000, Miriana wrote:
>
> > After reading John Kim's article on the DOTs and their
> > effectiveness, I decided to try them out in a dungeon environment. I
>
> The point of my article was to thank John Kim for his insight
> which is making the bard class much more fun to play for me. Melee +
> combat song + mana song was getting boring. This is really breathing new
> life into my interest in leveling my bard.

While I appreciate the compliment, others on the Concert Hall
had already come up with most of the numbers for the Chants.
I just added a couple comparisons to melee since I happened to
have some recent logfiles handy.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
